subtitle: paper on Hinduism read the Parliament on
the 19th of September 1893 three
religions now stand in the world which
have come down to us from time
prehistoric Hinduism Zoroastrianism and
Judaism they have all received
tremendous shocks and all of them proved
by their survival their internal
strength but while Judaism failed to
absorb Christianity and was driven out
of its place of birth by its
all-conquering daughter and a handful of
Parsees all it remains to tell a tale of
the ground religion sect after sect
arose in India and seemed to shake the
religion of the Vedas to it's very
foundation but like the waters of the
seashore and a tremendous earthquake it
receded only for a while only to return
in an all absorbing flood a thousand
times more vigorous and when the tumult
of the rush was over these sects were
all sucked in absorbed and assimilated
into the immense body of the mother
faith from the high spiritual flights of
the Vedanta philosophy of which the
latest discoveries of science seem like
echoes to the low tides and ideas of
idolatry with its multifarious mythology
the agnosticism of the Buddhists and the
atheism of the Jains each and all have a
place in the Hindu religion where then
the question arises where is the common
center to which all of these widely
diverging radii converge where is the
common basis upon which all these
seemingly hopeless contradictions rest
and this is the question I shall attempt
to answer the Hindus have received their
religion through revelation of the Vedas
they hold that the Vedas are without
beginning and without end
it may sound ludicrous to this audience
how a book can be without beginning or
end but by the Vedas no books are meant
they mean the accumulated treasury of
spiritual lies discovered by different
persons in different times just as a law
of gravitation existed before its
discovery and would exist if all
humanity forgot it so it is with the
laws that govern the spiritual world the
moral ethical and spiritual relations
between soul and soul and between
individual spirits and the father of all
spirits were there before their
discovery and would remain even
we forgot them the discoverers of these
laws were called Rishi's and we honor
them as perfected beans I am glad to
tell this audience that some of the very
greatest of them were women here it may
be said that these laws or laws may be
without end but they must had a
beginning the Vedas teaches that
creation is without beginning her end
science is said to have proved that the

same then if there was a time when
nothing existed where was all this
manifested energy some say it was in a

is sometimes potential and sometimes

everything mutable is a compound and

God would die which is absurd therefore
there never was a time when there was no

God is the ever act of Providence by

the Sun and the moon the Lord created

aye-aye-aye what is the idea before me
the idea of a body am I then nothing but

it must die some are born happy enjoy
perfect health with beautiful body
mental vigour and all Watts applying
others are born miserable some are

why does it just and merciful God create

there must have been causes then before

are not all the tendencies of the mind

matter if mater and its transformation
answer for all that we have there is no

and if a philosophical monism is
inevitable spiritual monism is certainly

that tendency this is an accord with

necessary to explain the natural habits

not obtained in the present life they

there is another suggestion taking all
these for granted how is it that I do
not remember anything in my past life
well this can be easily explained
I am now speaking English it is not my

past life so then the Hindu believes
that he is a spirit him the sword cannot

water cannot melt him the air cannot dry
the Hindu believes that every soul is a
circle whose circumference is nowhere
but whose centre is located in the body
and that death means a change of the

pure the absolute change even a
microscopic particle of its nature but
the Hindu is sincere he does not want to

I do not know how the perfect being the
soul came to think of itself as
imperfect as joined to and conditioned
by matter but the fact is
a fact for all of that it is a fact in
everyone's consciousness that one thinks

one is the body the answer that is the
will of God is no explanation there is
nothing more than what the Hindu says I
do not know well then the human soul is
eternal and immortal perfect and
infinite and death means only a change

present is determined by our past action
and the future by the present the soul
will go on evolving up or reverting back
from birth to birth and death to death
but here's another question his man a

ye children of immortal bliss even ye

you shall be saved from death over again
children of immortal bliss what is sweet

you are souls immortal spirits free
blessed and eternal ye are not matter ye

at the Vedas proclaim not a dreadful

friend
thou art the source of all strength give

thou art he that bear the burdens of the

beloved dear than everything in this and

Krishna whom the Hindus believed to have

like a lotus leaf which grows in water
but is never moistened by water so a man
ought to live in a world his heart to

Lord I do not want wealth nor children

I shall go from birth to birth but grant

they do not give me anything but my

I love the Lord he is a source of all

let him place me wherever he likes I
must love him for long sake
I cannot trade in love the vedas teach
at the soul is divine and only held in

yayyyy even in this life then and only
